description: This file defines a Kotlin class `MenuFragment` which is a user interface component for displaying restaurant menu items. It manages UI elements such as category chips, a recycler view for menu items, and interactions like adding items to cart, toggling favorites, and opening item options. It initializes data, handles user interactions, and observes data changes related to the cart and favorites.

classes.name: MenuFragment
classes.description: A Fragment subclass that displays a restaurant's menu, allowing users to browse categories, add items to cart, mark favorites, and view item options.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the adapter with interaction handlers when the fragment is created.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment's layout from XML.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Sets up UI components, binds data to views, and sets observers for cart and favorite changes.

methods.name: setupCategoryChips
methods.description: Creates and manages category filter chips for menu filtering.

methods.name: openOptionsAndAdd
methods.description: Opens a bottom sheet to configure and add an item to the cart.

methods.name: newInstance
methods.description: Creates a new instance of MenuFragment with specified restaurant ID.
